lines.text: So, how about... when the bullet turned around and hit Slick...
...the wound it created... gushed a ton of blood all over the <c=#FF6000>Go Wizard!</c>
Eugh, what?
Just- bang, he gets shot, blood goes everywhere!
Without sprayin' all over the floor nearby, and poolin' neatly around the wizard's body?
Uh... sure.
Th-that kind of blood pressure- if that were possible, he'd- he'd be dead long before now.
Okay, okay, so maybe it didn't just spray out.
But Slick got shot, right? He had a hole in him, so...
They just used that to drain Slick's blood, and use it to fake the blood on the <c=#FF6000>Go Wizard!</c>
...They'd need to get the body over there without gettin' blood on the floor.
And then... drain it neatly onto, what, a fake wound?
I feel like we'd see evidence of that.
Not if they cleaned it up! And that fire could hide that sort of thing, too!
We wouldn't even be able to tell if all his blood was still in him, if he burnt up enough!
Th-that's- that's not true.
Huh?
It's- I can tell- that isn't an exsanguinated corpse.
J-judging by the condition of the skin, and by- um, the mass of...
It's just- he was clearly cooked while most of his blood remained inside.
Uh-huh. And that's not just another misdirection to make me solve the case wrong?
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>It's a bit l-late for that...</f>
I mean, um. You don't have to- to take my w-word for it.
Call in another f-forensics tech- Ashton, maybe. Anyone would tell you the- the same thing.
...I'll let Ashton sleep.
Because... there's an <c=#FF00FF>easier place to get blood from,</c> right, Seeker?
...Now that you mention it...
